,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,<div id="center">$T[-Somewhere in Europe-]</div> The trip takes longer than you expected. At least it feels much longer. You’re 22 years old, fresh out of a Bachelor’s degree in Corporate Communication, whatever that’s supposed to mean, and you’re almost broke. An airplane ticket is out of the question. So you take the bus to London, where you catch the Eurostar to Paris; it’s crowded and not particularly comfortable; you have to wait a couple of hours in Paris before catching the international train from Gare de Lyon, where you settle in a comfortable position in your third-class seat. (display:"goto")[[Prepare for the long ride.]](set: $time to "21:45")(set: $hour to 21)(set: $minute to 45) (set: $money to 80)<div id="center">$T[-Somewhere in Europe-]</div> $A[Why did I decide to do this anyways?] It certainly wasn’t the money, though your bank account could appreciate every little bit it can get. “You’ll see the world and become wiser!” your mum said. “You’ll nail some hot Romanian chicks!” argued your friends. "I'll finally have time to work on my book!" you said to yourself. You bought into those arguments and now here you are, ready for an adventure. The train takes several days as it chugs its way through the green fields of eastern France, the small villages in the mountains of Germany and the hills of Austria, filled with more wind turbines and farms than you thought possible. You stop every now and then, get off at some station where you have a coffee and a sandwich while you chat to some random people, waiting for your next train relay. As you go farther East the locals speak less and less English and the polite Germanic accents are replaced with friendly but confused Slavic tones. You smile and nod, trying to remember some of the words. $A[After all, this is what it’s all about, right?] $prot[($nTask: "New task: Arrive at The Crooked Elm")] (display:"goto")[[Continue journey->get off.]](set: $day to "Friday")(set: $time to "9:20")(set: $hour to 9)(set: $minute to 20)<div id="center">$T[-Somewhere in Europe-]</div> The final train drops you off at Timisoara, a big city in western Romania. From there you take another bus to Lugoj, but after that things get harder. You have to get to a village that’s so small it’s not even on the map. You spend the night at a cheap hotel then convince one of the locals to give you a ride in exchange for what little you have left in your wallet. $I[You lost 80£] He drives silently as you follow the river Timish deeper into the mountains. The road is steep and perilous and in progressively worse condition the further away you go. You begin to wonder if you haven't fallen victim to some scam, the big country man next to you driving towards a secluded location... Before you have too much time to dwell on these thoughts, you spot a handful of rooftops nested among the trees. (display:"goto")[[Arrive at the village]](set: $day to "Saturday")(set: $hour to 15)(set: $minute to 50) (set: $money to 0)<div id="center">$T[-Somewhere in Romania-]</div> In any case, you arrive at //a village//. $a['Am I at the right place?'] you ask the man, but he shrugs, takes a few paces around the car to stretch his legs, then gets back in and drives off. You look around - there is a road sign with a name, but it's broken, half of it missing and the edge charred as if struck by lightning. Even on the remaining part the paint is so old that you can’t really make out any of the letters. Still, this has to be it - there are no other villages nearby. The village itself is very small - barely a few dozen stone houses at best. The mountain air is clean and fresh, filling your nostrils with the scent of old pines and green moss. Save for a few electric lamps barely illuminating the street, it doesn’t look very modern. Judging by the architectural style, it hasn't moved in the last few centuries. $A[Old and authentic, no technological distractions... this could be good for writing and inspiration. I'm sure there are lots of legends and folklore to get out of the locals, if I ask them nicely...] You notice a congregation of buildings that’s bound to be the main square. (display:"goto")[[Head to the village center]] (set: $time to "17:30")(set: $hour to 17)(set: $minute to 30)<div id="center">$vil</div> There isn't much here and you feel somewhat lost. $a[‘Excuse me, I’m looking for… “The Crooked Elm” hotel. It’s in this village…’] In your best Romanian you address a passerby, a man in his forties wearing a respectable however old-fashioned suit. Along with your explanation you vaguely gesture around, hoping that you don’t sound too ridiculous. Given how few houses there are it’s somewhat embarrassing that you haven’t found the place yourself. ‘The residence is located outside of town’ he replies, surprising you with his flawless English and deep, suave voice. ‘Head down the main road this way - there is a small torrent that later joins into the river. Follow the path upstream, towards the mountains, and you shall find it in about an hour.’ $a[‘An hour!’] you exclaim. Just when you thought your journey was over. (display:"goto")[[Peer towards the mountainside]] (set: $time to "18:00")(set: $hour to 18)(set: $minute to 0) (set: $timeStarted to true)<div id="center">$mount</div> You can make out the road the gentleman is talking about and even if you haven’t brought much luggage with you the thought of carrying your bags uphill for an hour disheartens you. $a[‘Isn’t there some sort of transportation?’] You turn around, but the man is gone. In fact there isn’t anyone else around - if you didn’t know any better, you would have said that the village was deserted. The trees rustle in the wind. It’s only 6 p.m. but the village is on an eastern slope and with the sun blocked behind the tall ridges, the world is already sinking in velvet shadows. You sigh. (display:"goto")[[Head towards the hotel on foot]](set: $hour to 19)(set: $time to "19:00")<div id="center">$mount</div> After what seems like an eternity of back pain and sweating along the old stony path, the trees thin out on the left and you see a tall ornate gate surrounded by a fence of metal bars. $I[ [ ]<obs| ] (display:"eye")(link-repeat:"Examine the gate")[(replace:?obs)[It appears to be hand forged and pretty solid, despite its state. There is a lock in the middle and two stone pillars on each side, decorated with stone gargoyles. You try to push it but it won't open, the metal only rattling ominously. You get the feeling that the statues are staring at you disapprovingly.]] (display:"eye")(link-repeat:"Examine the fence")[(replace:?obs)[It's old and rusty, but still pretty solid. The spaces between the bars are too thin for you to squeeze through. You briefly consider jumping over it, but the bars have spikes on top and you wouldn't risk getting injured on an old rusty edge so far away from a hospital.] ] (display:"goto")[[Look through the gate]]<div id="center">$mount</div> Behind you can make out a large grey manor built into the hillside. <div id="center"><img src="images/tr/environments/mansion.png" width="1200" align="center"></div> It’s several stories high, a central part and two wings with several towers and balconies looming over the mournful garden. It’s hard to make out everything in the darkness, but you estimate it has at least two dozen guest rooms, perhaps more. $A[Wow... the place must have been a real luxury resort back in the day, perhaps then the village was a popular tourist destination? A shame, now it reeks of disuse and decay... Could be a cool place to stay, but I doubt they get many visitors. On the bright side, my job as a receptionist is probably going to be a whole lot of sitting around, waiting and doing nothing. Perhaps I could go back down to the village and find a pub, befriend the locals? Or maybe get back to that book I've always wanted to write?] A thought for later. For now, you should just move in. (display:"goto")[[Look for a way to open the gate]]<div id="center">$mount</div> There doesn't seem to be any button attached to the gate, only a small brass doorbell with a string attached to it. It appears highly unlikely that anyone would be able to hear it all the way from here to the mansion. (display:"goto")[[Shout]] (display:"goto")[[Ring the doorbell]] (display:"goto")[[Try to call the hotel through your phone]]<div id="center">$mount</div> $a['Hellooooo? Anybody? I'm locked out here!!'] You yell a couple more times, but nothing happens. You pace in front of the gate as the minutes pass. A few of the windows are lit up, which calms you somewhat, but clearly they can't hear you from here. (display:"goto")[[Try to call the hotel through your phone]] (display:"goto")[[Ring the doorbell]] <div id="center">$gar</div> You pull the string and the bell rings with a faint and hollow sound. Instinctively, you step back without knowing why. After a few seconds, the gate creaks open. $A[What is this, a hidden mechanism, or some sort of an elaborate joke? Would they go to such lengths just to create the illusion of a haunted house? Maybe it's good for their business, but still... I'll have to come back and figure it out later.] Your back aches too much right now and even if there were a few hidden wires somewhere, you probably wouldn't be able to see them in the darkness anyways. (display:"goto")[[Take the path to the manor]](set: $time to "19:30")(set: $minute to 30)<div id="center">$mount</div> You take out your phone and attempt to call the manager - you were given a number following your online job application - but your phone is out of range. $A[Damn it!] You were quite certain there was service back in the village, but you really don't feel like doing another 1 hour walk down. And then up again. //Ugh.// (display:"goto")[[Shout]] (display:"goto")[[Ring the doorbell]] <div id="center">$gar</div> As you approach the main entrance, the front door creaks open and a silhouette of a man emerges from inside, carrying a metal candlestick. $A[Yeah, definitely using the old building and the props as a means of attracting more visitors...] Soon you're close enough to make out his features - he's middle aged, probably in his late fifties, with pale skin and bald head bearing a number of scars. <img src="images/tr/characters/ionut_3.png" width="400" align="right" class="char"> $Io['You must ve Alex. Ve vere vaiting for you. Come in.'] He takes your luggage and disappears inside. (display:"goto")[[Follow him.]] (set: $ionut_avatar to 1) (set: $timeStarted to true) $I[New character entry added to journal] ($nChar: "The Servant")<div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> You stumble inside a reception room with a dusty wooden desk and several hallways splitting in different directions. On the right side there is a large staircase leading somewhere up in the darkness. The whole place is scarcely illuminated by a handful of candles, most attached to the walls. $Io['Your room vill be ready in a moment.'] The man drops your luggage on the floor and takes the staircase, which creaks under each of his heavy steps. You follow the glow of his candle as he moves up until he takes a turn and disappears somewhere on the upper floor. (display:"eye")[[Examine the desk]] (display:"eye")[[Examine the hallways]] (display:"goto")[[Patiently wait]] <div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> The desk is relatively large and made from a heavy, thick wood. It's furniture from another generation, when chairs and desks were built to last. You don't think you could ever move it even if you tried. There's also a little stand on it with a sign that currently reads "CLOSED". Behind it is a stack of other signs - you flip through them: "OPEN", "BACK IN 10 MINUTES", "BEWARE OF DOG". The last one looks like it hasn't been used for a while. $A[So this is going to be my new workplace...] [(display:"eye")(link: "Circle to the other side")[ (replace:?desk)[You move from the place of a visitor to the receptionist's seat. A part of you feels like you're trespassing, but you calm it down - after all this is your desk now. There are a handful of drawers filled with paperwork that is too difficult to read in this light. You find the usual objects - pens, scissors, a guest register, a little whistle. Everything seems ordinary.] ] ]<desk| (display:"eye")[[Examine the hallways]] (display:"goto")[[Patiently wait]]<div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> You make a few steps into the hallways and the darkness quickly envelops you. Despite the candles the visibility is terrible and you get the feeling that the receptionist's desk is left somewhere far behind. With a slight unease you hurry to return to the relative illumination of the entrance. (display:"eye")[[Examine the desk]] (display:"goto")[[Patiently wait]] <div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> The minutes tick as you absent-mindedly fiddle with your phone, playing sudoku. There's still no service. $Mi['Good evening,'] comes a voice from behind. Startled, you turn around. <img src="images/tr/characters/mihai2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char"> A young gentleman with a black suit and a golden cane is staring at you under his eyebrows. $Mi['I'm Mihai Petrescu, the owner of the Crooked Elm. Or rather, the owner is my father, Vasil Petrescu, who is now too old to manage the business.'] (display:"talk")[['Hello']] (display:"talk")[['I'm Alex']] (display:"talk")[['Nice to meet you']] (set: $mihai_avatar to 1)(set: $time to "20:00") (set: $hour to 20) (set: $minute to 15) $I[New character entry added to journal] ($nChar: "Mihai, the Landlord")<div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> <img src="images/tr/characters/mihai2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char"> The man looks at you with a blank stare. $a['I'm-'] $Mi['I know who you are. I have your file, right here.'] Mihai produces a paper from one of his pockets. $Mi['Twenty-two years old. Single. Somewhat educated.'] $a['I went to university for three years...'] $Mi['There's no shame. We have a library - you're free to use it, should you have the time. Speaking of which-'] Mihai takes out a metal key ring with four heavy keys. $Mi['Here are your personal keys. One is for the gate outside, one for the front door, the library and for your room.'] You take the keys and hold them awkwardly in your hand. The key ring is way too large for your jeans' pockets. $Mi['So, do you have any questions?'] (set: $pers_keys to true) $prot[($nItem: "New items: keys added!")] (display:"talk")[['Yes, I'd like to ask you a few things'->questions?]] (display:"talk")[['I have no questions right now'->I have no more questions]]<div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> $Mi['I know who you are. A storm cut the line that's running from the village and the spare generator is out of fuel'] ] (replace:?q1)[] ] (click: ?q2)[(replace: ?dia)[$Mi['That was Ionut. He takes care of most things around here, including maintaining the manor, the garden, fixing and cleaning.'] You don't think Ionut is doing a particularly good job given the general disarray of the property, but you decide to keep that to yourself. (set: $ionut_avatar to 2) ($nChar: "Ionut, the Servant") $I[Character entry updated in journal]] (replace:?q2)[] ]<div id="center">$T[-ENTRANCE-]</div> $Mi['Very well, then. I'll show you to your room.'] Mihai heads to the staircase and starts climbing, waving you a hand to follow him. In the candlelight the many jeweled rings on his hand glitter mysteriously. You grab your bags and one of the candles. (display:"goto")[[Climb up]]<div id="center">$T[-FLOOR 1-]</div> The upper floor is covered by a soft red carpet that absorbs almost all noise. You can see a variety of weapons and trophies hung on the walls, as well as an ominous figure sanding at the far end. You squint your eyes and then relax - it's just an old piece of armor. You try to tentatively stomp the floor, but it's almost inaudible. For a while you're lost in the silence, not hearing the familiar tapping of Mihai's cane. Silence and darkness... Your eyes fall on a golden door right in front of you. One of many, in fact, as you realise looking both ways. $A[I wonder what's the room like...] $Mi['Over here, Mister Reid'] You see the light of the candle to the right, moving upwards still to the next floor. (display:"eye")[[Maybe take a quick glance inside the room...]] (display:"goto")[[Follow]]<div id="center">$T[-FLOOR 2-]</div> The next floor is almost identical, save for the carpet being purple and the doors a dark green. You can make out a handful of portraits along the walls, but before you have time to look properly at any of them, Mihai continues upwards. (display:"goto")[[Follow->Mihai continues upwards.]]<div id="center">$T[-FLOOR 1-]</div> You grab the doorhandle and twist it to the side, when you get the eerie sensation that you're being watched. With the corner of your eye you catch a flickering in the distant end of the hallway. You turn around, but there's nothing there. Even with squinting your eyes, you can't tell what was the thing that flickered. $A[What the hell...? Do they have security cameras in this place?] You look left and right again, trying to locate the source of your anxiety, but the dark hallways offer little consolation. In the end you leave the door alone. (display:"goto")[[Follow your host->Follow]]<div id="center">$T[-ATTIC-]</div> The third floor is noticeably different, with sloped ceilings and a larger number of doors indicating smaller, cramped spaces. <img src="images/tr/characters/mihai2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char"> $Mi['The garrets and storage rooms are on this floor.'] says Mihai. $Mi['As well as the staircases that lead to the towers. But Ionut will give you a proper tour around tomorrow. You must be terribly tired. This is your room.'] He leads you to a door located not far on the left, seemingly indistinct from the others apart from the small metal plaque indicating number 5. Mihai produces a single key from the inside of his vest and with a subtle //click// the door opens. $A[That must be the master key that opens every door around here... makes sense. No need for *him* to carry a large batch of keys around.] $Mi['Sleep well. Tomorrow is Sunday and we aren't expecting any visitors, so you'll have the day to yourself. Use it to get familiar with the place. Go to the village if you like, but don't spend the whole day there. Your work starts on Monday morning. Ionut will explain your duties.'] You nod and smile politely. (display:"goto")[[Go to your room->your room]]. (set:$door=0)(set: $time to "21:30")(set: $hour to 21)(set: $minute to 30)<div id="center">$room</div> Small and simple, your room has just the bare necessities - a bed, a wardrobe, a desk and a chair. A single window is looking out to what you expect is the back garden. There is also a nightstand with a drawer and a lamp, candlestick and an inkwell on top. $A[Power seems to go out pretty often...] $I[ [ ]<act| ] (display:"eye")(link-repeat:"Look into the wardrobe")[(replace: ?act)[$wardrobe] ] (display:"eye")(link-repeat:"Look into the drawer")[(replace: ?act)[$drawer ] ] [ (display:"goto") (link:"Lock the door")[(replace: ?act)[$I[The door is now locked] ] (replace:?lock)[]] <br>]<lock| [(display:"goto")(link:"Unpack your stuff")[(replace: ?act)[$I[You store a handful of t-shirts, jeans and socks into the wardrobe.] ](replace:?task)[ $I[You have completed a task! Journal updated.] $prot[($nTask: "Task completed: Arrive at the Crooked Elm")]] (set:$maintask to 1) (replace:?unpack)[] (set:$wardrobe="A few t-shirts, jeans and socks; some blankets, a spare pillow")] <br>]<unpack| (display:"goto")(link-repeat:"Sleep")[(if: $wardrobe is "A few t-shirts, jeans and socks; some blankets, a spare pillow")[(goto:"Sleep")](else:)[(replace: ?act)[$R[You should unpack your stuff before going to sleep] ] ]] (set: $time to "9:00") (set: $hour to 9) (set: $minute to 0) (set: $day to "Sunday") []<task|<div id="center">$T[-YOUR ROOM-]</div> You wake up refreshed, your hard mattress and simple cover providing surprisingly good sleep. Looking through the window in the daylight, you can see a large garden spanning behind the manor - alleys lined with elm trees, stone benches and statues, even a little fountain. You get dressed, picking a pair of jeans and t-shirt. The day is ahead of you, but perhaps first you should have some breakfast? $prot[($nTask: "New task: Explore the Manor and the Village")] (display:"goto")[[To the dining room->some breakfast]] (set: $hishills to true) (set: $legmount to true) (set: $antcat to true) [(unless: (passage:)'s tags contains "splash")[(display:"protection")<div id="boxNew">(display:"info.avatar")<br>(display:"info.bracelet")(if: (passage:)'s name contains "drunk")[<img src="images/tr/interface/clock.png" style="position: absolute; float:left; margin-top:-1px;" width="40">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp(text-style: "blurrier")[ **1?:??**] ](else:)[<img src="images/tr/interface/clock.png" title="Time" style="position: absolute; float:left; margin-top:-1px;" width="40"> (text-style: "subscript")[ &nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp [**$hour:(if:$minute >0 and $minute< 10)[0]$minute(if:$minute is 0)[0]** ]<time| ]] (text-style: "subscript")[<div style="line-height:30px;">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp $day</div>(display:"sanity.icon")(display:"lewd.icon")<br>$I[You have £[$money]<money| ](if: $secrets>0)[<br>You hold $M[|secret>[$secrets] Secret(if: $secrets>1)[s]]](else:)[<br>(if: $av is 3)[<br>]] (if: $dead>=1)[$R[Deaths:$dead] ](else:)[<br>]<br>(if: (passage:)'s name contains "invglow")[(text-style:"blur")[ [[You]] ] ](else:)[ (test-true: $protection is true)[(display:"profile.icon") [[You]] <br>(display:"journal.icon") [[Journal]] <br> $ach1[(display:"feats.icon") [[Feats->Achievements]] ] ](else:)[(display:"profile.icon") $U[You] <br>(display:"journal.icon") $U[Journal] <br>$ach1[(display:"feats.icon") $U[Feats] ] ] ] <br>(display:"cog"){ (if: (saved-games:) contains "Slot A")[ (link:"Quick Save")[ (set: $confirm to (confirm: "Override save data?"))(if: $confirm)[(if:(save-game:"Slot A", "0. (set: $deathlist to (a: "none")) (set: $flashspider to 0) (set: $elise_level to 0) (set: $mihai_level to 0) (set: $ionut_level to 0) (set: $felicia_level to 0) (set: $wolf_level to 0) (set: $inn_level to 0) (set: $myst_level to 0) (set: $beadsexpl to true) (set: $elise_servant to false) (set: $rando to (colour:#FFCC99)) (set: $myst_visited to 0) (set: $lavius_level to 0) (set: $av to 1) (set: $zach to true) (set: $zach_level to 0)(set: $zach_friends to 0) (set: $withzach to false) (set: $z to (colour:#FFCC99)) (set: $visited_lab_alone to 0) (set: $lust to 0) (set: $special to ((text-style:"bold")+(colour:#CC99FF))) (set: $ionut_visited to false) (set: $ionut_dishes to 0) (set: $secrets to 0) (set: $suit_mod to 0)(set: $shop2 to 0)(set: $work1 to true) (set: $lav_firstdeath to 0) (set: $desksign to "CLOSED") (set: $first_willing_sex to "none")(set:$phero_talk to 0)(set: $recharge_explained to 0)(set: $bow to false)(set: $lav_busy to 0)(set: $rested to 0) (set: $potion_explained to 0)(set: $elise_trial to 0)(set: $read_day to 0)<div id="center"> [$T[-Transylvania-]]<fontbig| </div> (set: $startHAX to 1)(save-game:"Slot 1","---A Fresh Start---") Welcome to Transylvania! This is an interactive text-based adventure that focuses on horror and mystery. Your choices matter, so think carefully how you want to handle the situations that are presented to you. **Please note that as a horror experience, some scenes contain light amounts of gore. This is why the game is marked as 18+ and viewer discretion is advised.** (Disclosure : this game uses cookies to save your progress locally.) **I AM A NEW PLAYER** (display:"goto")[[Begin the game->Start2]] **I HAVE PLAYED BEFORE** $T[Chapter 1] (display:"goto")[Skip Prologue]<vet| $T[Chapter 2] (display:"goto")[Simulate progression to chapter 2]<sim| (set:$hour to 14) (set:$minute to 00) (set:$day to "Tuesday") (set: $money to 0) (set: $test to 1) (click:?new)[(goto:"Start2")] (click:?vet)[(goto:"Sleep2")](click:?sim)[(goto:"Simulate progression to chapter 2")](if: $intro is 3)[(goto:"day1_short")]<div id="center">$din</div> After some searching you find the dining hall on the ground floor, near the reception. It's a spacious room lined with tall windows creating the illusion of a glass wall looking towards the garden. The light that stems in is a dirty grey, and while a little melancholic, you don't find it unpleasant. <img src="images/tr/characters/ionut_3.png" width="400" align="right" class="char"> You look at the antique chairs and tables, wondering if they're fully functional or just for decoration. $Io['Sit! Today - I cook. Vat do you vant?'] The servant's face peers through an opening in the opposite wall, complete with a metal counter and stacks of plates. $A[That must be the kitchen...] $a['I'll have eggs and bacon.'] you shout back. $Io['Coming vright up!'] Soon you hear a pleasant sizzling and then Ionut comes out, dropping a hot plate of bacon and eggs on your table. You notice that he walks a little funny, but your mind is busy elsewhere. $A[Perhaps his leg hurts?] It doesn't matter. You start munching and tell yourself that he doesn't look like a bad guy after all. Yesterday he looked a little creepy, insidious even, but right now you're willing to believe he's just the average Joe who happens to have a strong accent and misshapen, bald head. It's hardly his fault. $Io['It is gud, ja?'] $a['Ja, ja, sehr gut!'] you reply instinctively. The trip through Europe really scrambled your head with languages. Before you can correct your mistake however, he returns to the kitchen. (display:"goto")[[Finish your eggs.]] (set: $hour to 9)(set: $minute to 30)(set: $tour to 0)(set: $library_found to 0)<div id="center">$din</div> You push your empty plate aside and pat your belly. That was a good breakfast. As if sensing that you're done, the servant emerges again and comes to sit in front of you, placing two cups of coffee on the table. $Io['Nice to meet. I Ionut.'] he grins at you. $a['Hello, Ionut, I'm Alex,'] you reply. There is an awkward pause. $Io['So, start tomorrow.'] $a['Yes. What do I have to do?'] $Io['Several things. Virst: stay at reception.'] $a['The whole day?'] $Io['From 6 to 10.'] $a['6 to 10?!' that's 18 hours!'] $Io['No, only 4 hours'], he corrects you - $Io['6 in the avternoon.'] You look at Ionut, confused. $Io['Nobody come early. Guest come - they sleep; they go.'] $A[That explains why the pay is so low...but I'll have lots of free time, so that's not too bad.] (display:"talk")[[Do many people come here?]] (display:"talk")[[What else do I have to do?]] (if: $ionut_avatar is 1)[(set: $ionut_avatar to 2) ($nChar: "Ionut, the Servant") $I[Character entry updated in journal] ]<div id="center">$din</div> $Io['Help move their luggage to room. Give key, of course. Keys behind desk.'] Ionut takes a sip from his coffee, as if thinking if he's forgetting anything. His skin, pale and thick, makes his face look like an unfinished clay sculpture. $a['So... that's it?'] You still can't believe that your work day is only 4 hours. $Io['That's it. During day you free. If need help - I ask, you come. If Mister Petrescu need something - he tell you. Rest of time - up to you. Try not get lost in the forest.'] You drink your own coffee, letting the information sink in. It seems that you'll have some time on your hands. (display:"talk")[[So, can you give me a tour?]] (display:"talk")[[Thanks Ionut, that's all for now.]](if:$intro>1)[(goto:"short_tour")]<div id="center">$rec</div> $Io['Yes. Come.'] You stand up and follow the servant. $Io['Ve are in the dining hall. If you vant breakvast - before 11. If you vant dinner - betveen 20 and 22. Else - stay hungry.'] Looking at Ionut, it's hard to tell if he's being serious or is attempting some kind of joke. In either case, he continues the tour. $Io['Ground floor - center - reception; left side - kitchen; right side - saloon, rooms for games.'] $a['Games?'] $Io['Mostly cards and pool. Go if you vant. Avter that - library. Need key.'] $a['Yes, Mr. Petrescu gave me one yesterday.'] $Io['Good.'] Ionut waves towards the stairway. (set: $library_found to 1) (display:"goto")[[Climb upstairs->up the stairs]] <div id="center">$din</div> Ionut gives you a nod and finishes his coffee. The day is still young and you have some options of what to do. You walk along it for a while, but it keeps going as far as you can see, the terrain becoming rougher and even less well-kept the farther away from the mansion you go. Eventually the low, sickly grass is replaced by ever taller thorns and bushes, making your advance difficult. When you're about to give up, you notice another $in[gate] in the fence. (display:"goto")[[Go to the gate->gate]] (set: _ti to 20)<div id="center">$vil</div> You know that the village isn't much, but it's still your closest link to civilization, so you force yourself to do the hour walk downhill, trying not to think that you'll have to climb back again. You arrive at the village winded, but the fresh mountain air helps you quickly cool down. The tall mountain trees cast the village into a deep shade and despite the burning summer sun in its zenith, the place feels veiled from its heat. (if: $duh is 0)[(set: $hour to ($hour+1))] $A[Like it was in another world...] You explore the village roads, the fleeting faces of its inhabitants glancing at you through the windows as you go. You never meet anyone's gaze directly, but you can feel their eyes on the back of your head, following you around. (set: $duh to 1) You expected the village to be only a few simple households, but during your walk you discover there is an $in[antique shop], a small $in[inn] and a $in[hunting cabin]. (display:"goto")[[Have a look at the antique shop->antique shop]] (display:"goto")[[Go to the hunting cabin->hunting cabin]] (display:"goto")[Visit the inn]<inn| (click:?inn)[(if: $inn_visited is 0)[(goto:"inn")](elseif: $inn_visited is 1)[(goto:"inn2")]]<div id="center">$ant</div> Hidden in between two massive stone houses, the antique shop is a sort of extension linking its neighbours, making you think of some sort of small critter that saw an empty space and decided to dwell there. Its narrow facade - with barely enough space for a small door and a single window - and irregular architecture were the reason you miss it the first few times, but you eventually notice the faded inscription infront "ANT QUE BOUTI UE". You push the door of the boutique, bending a little to avoid hitting your head on the low doorframe. The inside of the shop is dusty and cramped with hundreds of small objects - you see furniture and decorations; jewelry, small figurines and toys; watches, mostly mechanical as far as you can tell; pens and quills; posters, stamps and postcards, a lot of ornate boxes and an immense sea of undefined and unknowable shapes. The shop is illuminated by small electric bulbs that cover everything with a dirty, yellow light, as if it was a second-hand light used and reused throughout the centuries and too tired to shine like it used to. The boutique, though cramped and narrow, extends inward, like the belly of a giant whale which has swallowed thousands of objects over its life and now lies comatose, slowly digesting. With the corner of your eye you sense something moving. Her hair is dark and curly, with a tinge of violet, her skin - flawless and pale like marble, and her green eyes - is that a hint of yellow? - peer straight through you with a wild, feline stare. <img src="images/tr/characters/felicia_desk.png" width="600" align="right" class="char" id="feliciaPC"><img src="images/tr/characters/felicia2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char" id="feliciaMobile"> $M['See something that you like?'] she purrs at you. $a['I- uh-, wha-'] $M['You look like a man in need of an accessory.'] She decides looking you up and down. $M['Perhaps a watch?'] Without waiting for your reply, she transitions instantaneously from one side of the counter to the other, standing next to you, her fingers already picking different watches from the dusty shelves, giving them a soft brush before sliding them around your wrist, giving a short $M["tss, tss, not the right one"] and putting them back on the row again. $a['I-, oh-, wait-'] $M['Not a watch then? I understand. Not really your thing. But you need something, oh yes, I can sense that you need something. Something to keep you safe, something to keep you //fresh//.'] $a['To keep me wha-'] $M['Oh, I know! You look down and notice that you now have new $in[bracelet]. ($nItem: "New items: a strange bracelet") [(display:"eye")Examine the bracelet]<br| (click: ?br)[(replace:?br)[It's made out of leather laces and decorated with small, dark beads. (if: $maintask is 1)[($nTask: "Humble Beginnings: Begin work") ($nTask: "An unexpected gift: Learn more about the bracelet")] $I[Your journal has been updated!] (set: $maintask to 2)(set: $task_felicia to 1) (if: $hour < 18)[(display:"goto")[[Go to the hunting cabin->hunting cabin]] (display:"goto")(if: $inn_visited is 0)[[[Go to the inn->inn]]](elseif: $inn_visited is 1)[[[Go to the inn->inn2]]] (display:"goto")[[Go to the antique shop]] (display:"bk")[[Return to the manor]] ](if: $hour >= 18)[ $R[It's very late. You knock, but there's no answer. [[Back->the village]] (set: _ti to 20)<div id="center">$mount</div> You leave the village behind, your head filled with more questions than answers. You wanted to stretch your feet a little and locate any potential points of interest that could distract you during your working holiday; instead, you stumbled upon a mysterious woman in an eerie shop and a village full of secretive inhabitants. The more you think about it the fuzzier your memories become, to the point where you start questioning if it wasn't all just a dream. But then you look down on your wrist, the little bracelet dangling inconspicuously with its strange beads as if it was pretending to be a normal object. //Pretending.// A shiver runs down your spine. The uphill climb is as tiring as it was yesterday and when you climb back up to the manor an hour later you're panting and sweating. <img src="images/tr/environments/mansion.png" width="1200" align="center"> Fortunately the cool mountain air quickly refreshes you and with confident steps you [[head to the front entrance.->Reception]] (set: _ti to 60)<div id="center">$vil</div> You approach the door of the inn again, but the trap door opens before you even knock. (set: _ti to 30) $hishills[ [[History of the hills]] ] $antcat[ [[The antique cat]] ] $legmount[ [[Legends from the Mountains]] ] <div id="center">$lib</div> It appears to be some sort of history book, the yellow pages printed with the heavy, slightly smudged ink of the old printing press. You open the volume at page 25: (set: $books_read += 1) $B1[**Dating back to the Slavic tribes before the middle ages, the inhabitants of what is known today as the Romanian mountains have always followed a strict code of social and geopolitical hierarchy, separating the region into autonomous constituencies known as "hills". Every hill had its own ruler, a hereditary title, who held power over the land and its people and in exchange vowed protection for his subjects. Some believe that the modern expression "king of the hill" originated from these early societal structures. Throughout the history of the region, different countries and kings have claimed the territories to be within their borders, but they have mostly respected the hills and their power.**] It's not a bad read, but you progress slowly, often checking words with the romanian dictionary you downloaded on your phone. After a while you decide that there are better things you could do with your time. You open a chapter at random: $B2[//Transylvanian folklore has become known worldwide for its legends about **vampires**. One of the common misconceptions however, associated with this mythos, is the portrayal of the vampire as a solitary creature that inhabits some distant and forsaken place such as a castle or a ruin. In truth, vampires are depicted in the old tales as social creatures that live in packs and abide by a strict hierarchy. Every pack is led by an Elder, a powerful being that has acquired knowledge and skills over centuries. He is followed by his son^^1^^ and then by a handful of lesser vampires who usually do not live in the same place but in surrounding villages or dwellings, which together form the **Elder Covenant**. ^^1^^//]$B2sub[ The Elder always has a single son to avoid infights for the heritage. While vampires are portrayed with a lifespan of centuries, they're not believed to be immortal, and thus the son eventually replaces his father and becomes the new Elder. Elders do not take other vampires for wives for the same reason - a potential claim for power - and thus resort to humans for the purpose of breeding.] (set: _ti to 30) (set: $legmount to false) (set: $books_read += 1) (if: $hour<23 and $books_read<3)[Perhaps you could take a look at another book? $antcat[(display:"eye") [[The antique cat]] ] $hishills[(display:"eye") [[History of the hills]] ] ] (if: $books_read is 3 and $hour<23)[ You've read everything you could find for now, perhaps you should [head back.]<rec| ] (if: $hour>=23)[ $R[It's too late to continue reading. She is tall and dark - her ebony skin and short black hair reflecting the light with an almost metallic sheen. However what is most peculiar about her are her proportions - her head is small and thin, her stick-like arms flail around her equally thin torso which is covered with a tight leather jacket. And still, despite this slim and skinny upper section, under her waist her body bulges out into an entirely different shape: her ass - round and protruding - is almost a separate entity altogether, occupying - you genuinely wonder - almost as much space as the rest of her. She takes a seat across the table from Mihai, occupying what appears to be the biggest armchair you've ever seen, with a seat large enough for two people to sit on side by side comfortably and a tall back covered in numerous fancy cushions. Her slim body and small round head look almost ridiculous in comparison, yet somehow she seems to fill the chair quite nicely with the rest of her body... Looking at her you start getting a headache and you move your gaze away, rubbing your tired eyes. The room is so dark and the candles so faint that the shadows are starting to play tricks on you.. There are matches left near the hatch and you use them to light a torch which illuminates well enough the space several feet around you. Nobody will ever know a thing... You start climbing, using the screen of your phone as a source of light to guide your way. Even if there isn't any reception up here, at least it's good for something. The staircase continues for quite some time, spiraling upwards for what seems like hundreds of steps. From time to time there are doors on the side, but you're really interested in getting to the top. After what seems like an eternity, you reach the last step and a small platform leading to a single wooden door. Fortunately enough, there isn't any lock here, only a brass handle that looks like it hasn't been used in a while. You draw a deep breath and [[enter the room]].<div id="center">$dark</div> The faint light of your screen illuminates a small halo around you in what seems like complete and total darkness. There aren't any silhouettes of objects around you - no furniture, no old stuff, nothing at all. You turn to all directions but as far as you can tell the room is empty. And completely dark. It's a darkness that envelops you and sticks to your clothes, a rich and dense darkness which makes it hard to breathe and almost drowns you. Walking in a straight line you reach the wall - and indeed the windows - and examine them with increasing astonishment. They have been covered with some black and impenetrable material that makes it impossible to tell that it's actually day outside. Raising your phone higher, you see the something big and round hanging from the ceiling above. It shifts uneasily, as if irritated by the light you're pointing towards it, it's enormous leathery wings curling to protect it's head... '**Vat have you done!!!**' You turn around to the enormous figure of Ionut charging towards you at full speed. $A[**'Wait, I was ju-'**] He swings at you in a blur and you feel something cold and heavy on the side of your head, followed by a metallic taste in your mouth and the world [[fading away....]] $I[Task completed: **Locks, keys, and secrets**] (set: $task_elder to 3) ($nTask: "Task completed: Locks, keys and secrets") $sc1[$sys[You have learned a new secret: The Tower] (set: $secrets to (it +1)) ($nSecret: "The Tower") (set: $sc1 to false )] <div id="center">$T[-???????-]</div> The ground beneath you is cold and rough, the rocks painfully digging into your spine. Your entire body feels numb and heavy, as if an enormous weight is pushing you down. With great effort you force your eyes open and stare at the grey sky above. And the walls of earth around you. $A[**'Mhmhmhmhmhm!!!'**] You try to scream, but your mouth is gagged. Ionut, towering somewhere above you, continues his work with the shovel, slowly and methodically burying your body five feet into the barren soil. Panic sets in and you begin to struggle, trying to get out, but your(if:$dead>0)[ weak, feminine] hands and feet are bound and the increasing weight of the earth on top of you is too much. (display:"goto")[[Return to the hotel->best option]] <div id="center">$dark</div> The road is dark and barely distinguishable, even under the full moon. If you hadn't already walked it a number of times you'd be long lost. The forest, black and forbidding, is eerily quiet save for the wind blowing between the pines. Then there is another sound - the distant howling of wolves, somewhere to the east. You're acutely aware just how dangerous this path can be at night. You should have never stayed this late at the village, but damn the time flew impossibly at the antique shop. Suddenly you catch something with the corner of your eye, a blurry movement between the trees on the other side of the stream. Curiosity however is topped by the voice of caution and your pace quickens, not waiting to see what is lurking about. There was something sinister and unnatural in the silhouette that you saw and you're not going to stick around to see up close what it was. A howl tears through the night, long and piercing and, worst of all, right behind you. You switch into a sprint, running as fast as you can, but soon you can hear steps behind you, approaching fast. With the blood pumping in your ears and the world spinning wild, you leave the clearing of the path and plunge into the [[darkness of the trees]]. <div id="center">$dark</div> You manage to gain some distance and can no longer hear the steps behind you, but carry on running anyways, the thorns and bushes catching on your newly acquired outfit and tearing it up with a hundred small cuts. When you feel that you've lost your pursuer, whoever it was, you finally stop to catch your breath, leaning your back behind a big mossy boulder. Your lungs feel on fire and every breath is a pain in your chest, but at least you got away. The bad part is that the forest is utterly dark and you have no idea where you are. Eventually you reach a section where numerous dresses and overcoats are left hanging, followed by other old garments of all varieties.", "You take the familiar path downhill following the little stream. Perhaps the mountain air is already having a positive effect or perhaps you're getting used to the road, but this time the trip is less exhausting. The forest around you is beautiful in an eerie way, the tall trees casting a deep shade that has stifled most of the low vegetation between them, creating a surprisingly clear space on the ground, filled mostly with lots of dry pinecones and the occasional bush.", "The doors of the hatch take some effort to lift but you eventually manage to open them, removing the vines that have already started to crawl on top. The inside of the basement is more akin to the opening of a dungeon, with a cold stony floor and pillars supporting the manor on top. There are matches left near the hatch and you use them to light a torch which illuminates well enough the space several feet around you. There are pipes and valves covering most of the east wall and going into the ceiling, as well as a handful of crates, a workbench and some tools hanging near it, more torches and cobwebs wobbling by the cold draft; and of course, there is the generator. On the opposite side of the room there is another door leading further down...", "With a hungry stomach, you enter the dining hall and are greeted with a strange sight. All the windows have been covered with heavy wooden shutters from the exterior, such that barely any sunlight enters the room at all. To compensate for this, candles have been lit on almost all of the tables, their faint flames doing little but pushing the darkness a couple of feet away. Sitting on a large ornate table not far from the entrance, you recognise the silhouette of a man with a golden cane. 'Ah, Mr. Reid. Coming for some breakfast?' 'Yes, I was hungry... pardon my curiosity, Mr. Petrescu' - you decide to lean on the side of caution when addressing your boss - 'but what is all this?' 'Just having breakfast with an old friend, no cause for worry. It's much more romantic this way, don't you find?' Something in his tone implies that disagreement is not really an option. 'Yes, of course, Mr. Petre-' 'Although it would be better with the grand chandelier' - he points upwards towards a heavy ball of light bulbs and crystals - 'but unfortunately the power is still down. Speaking of which, have you any intention of going down to the village today?'", "'Eggs and bakon, ja?' You give him a nod and he disappears again, followed by the sound of sizzling. A few minutes later, while you're eating in the semi-complete darkness of the dining hall, a new silhouette enters the room. You immediately identify the bizarre outline of the woman you met earlier. She takes a seat across the table from Mihai, occupying what appears to be the biggest armchair you've ever seen, with a seat large enough for two people to sit on side by side comfortably and a tall back covered in numerous fancy cushions. Her slim body and small round head look almost ridiculous in comparison, yet somehow she seems to fill the chair quite nicely with the rest of her body... Looking at her you start getting a headache and you move your gaze away, rubbing your tired eyes. The room is so dark and the candles so faint that the shadows are starting to play tricks on you.. Bits of the conversation make their way to you, but it's too low and jumbled to make any sense.", " To your surprise, one of the doors on your right opens and a woman walks out in the hallway, walking towards you without a sound. She is tall and dark - her skin and short hair black as ebony. However what is most peculiar about her are her proportions - as she advances you can see the outline of her body: her head is small and thin, and her stick-like arms flail around her equally skeletal torso which, if it has breasts at all, hides them very well under a tight leather jacket. And still despite this slim and skinny upper section, under her waist her body bulges out into an entirely different shape: her ass - round and protruding - is almost a separate entity altogether, occupying - you genuinely wonder - almost as much space as the rest of her. ", "You leave your room and head instinctively towards the staircase, when a cold breeze brushes an icy finger on your cheek. You look both ways - all the windows are closed - but after all this is a pretty old house... Suddenly, you're feeling a little curious to explore the top floor. Both Mihai and Ionut were very brief about it, and you wonder if there aren't some hidden delights to find - perhaps an opening to the roof? Surely the view to the mountain will be breathtaking. And then there are the towers... you could always take a peek around. ", "You wake up full of energy and ready to take on the world! Despite the limited commodities, you had a good night's sleep and are looking forward to your first day of work. ...which starts at 6pm. In your enthusiasm you'd almost forgotten. Still, you'll probably find something useful to do during the day! ", " "))<div id="center">$room</div> You slowly wake up, your eyes opening to the familiar view of your room's ceiling. The dark mist in your mind slowly disperses and is replaced with mounting confusion. (set: $A to ((color:#FFCCE5)+(text-style: "italic"))) (set: $a to (color:#FFCCE5)) $A[What was that....? A dream..? Hallucination? Drugs? How the hell am I alive? It was all so real...] You rise in your bed and toss the covers aside. There is an immediate and profound sensation that something is off. Then apprehension strikes - your body is different. Smaller waist; leaner, hairless legs; you raise up your hands - they're similar, but definitely different - smaller, more delicate; your gaze falls down on a pair of mounds bulging your pyjamas. You shoot out of bed and into the small bathroom attached to your chamber, where a strange new face is looking at you in the mirror. Well, some of it is not new - your eyes are the same, dark brown, unchanged; your hair is almost the same, dark straight, though perhaps longer. You concentrate on your features - they have shifted around in slight but important ways, crafting the face of a young, beautiful woman staring with an open jaw and wide, terrified eyes. Stumped in shock, you fall a few steps back. (display:"goto")[[Sit on the bed]] (set: $pers_keys to true){(live: 0.1s)[ (set: $print to ((history:)'s (((history:)'s length) - $test ))) (display: $print) (if: $test<((history:)'s length))[(set: $test +=1)] (if: $test is (((history:)'s length)-1))[(goto: "reborn1")] [ ]<wind| ]} <div style="text-align:center;">$T[CHAPTER 1: THE WOLF, THE BAT AND THE SPIDER] </div> You've finished the introduction of Transylvania! From now on you will have more freedom to explore the world and make a variety of choices that lead to branching paths. I recommend saving the game here in case you want to go back and do things differently. [If you wish to continue with the story blind and without spoiling anything, [[wake up<-click here.]] If you wish to know the basic mechanics of the game, [click here]<info|. ]<chap1| (click: ?info)[ $I[-the goal of each chapter is to finish the day successfully; -there are different success states that can be obtained; -most actions cost you time and as such you may not be able to do everything you wish; -some options are only available at specific times of day, such as **breakfast** and **dinner**; -likewise the options in a given location (such as the inn or library) will change throughout the game, based on your past actions and other circumstances; -your death is not the end of the game;] (display:"goto")[[Continue->wake up]] (replace:?chap1)[ ] ] (set: $bracelet to 1) (set: $ionut_avatar to 2)(set: $mihai_avatar to 2) (set: $felicia_avatar to 1) (set: $task_felicia to 1) <div id="center">$room</div> Thinking is hard and as you clutch your head with both hands your thoughts buzz inside like a swarm of angry wasps, too fast and dangerous to catch. Minutes pass until you manage to calm down your beating heart. Your gaze absent-mindedly falls on the bracelet on your hand and the (colour:"#FFCCCC")[four crimson beads] that decorate it. $A[Alright, Alex.. what's going on? Did I take any drugs? Did someone slip me something?] You let the confusion wash over you for a few minutes, then your rational mind kicks in. $A[This is real.] You pinch your thigh and the pain reaches your brain, sobering it up. $A[I'm Alex, I was a student, I grew up with my parents in England...] A wave of new and confusing memories swirls around your head, but you chase them away. $A[...and then I travelled to Romania for a summer job. I'm currently in a hotel in a village located high in the mountains above Timisoara.] You look down at the two small bumps on your chest currently covered by your pyjamas. $A[...and apparently somehow, for some reason, I have become a girl.] You try to think very hard about the last thing you remember, but your recollection from last night is vague at best. $A[Given the irrefutable weight of reality, I must allow the possibility that the supernatural exists and it has affected me in some way. In some very peculiar way indeed...] The shock subsiding, you look down at your changed body again, with a pique of curiosity. Ignoring the circumstances of the event, it is quite the extraordinary experience. $A[What is it like, being a girl?] you wonder. All around, the room is littered with bones of various shapes and sizes, all gnawed to a clean white. Beside them lay the corpses of smaller animals, sucked dry and shriveled as if there remained nothing but a layer of skin covered by dry fur. Your attention shifts back to yourself - laying on your back, body wrapped in a cocoon neck to toes, with only your head sticking out to breathe. You can't help but notice that your belly is bulging out abnormally, swollen to the size of a basketball. You fall to your knees. $A[What the hell...] You see yourself, $str[cocooned]tied on the bed, a giant silhouette of a black $str[spider]woman behind you, $str[descending from the ceiling]coming out of the wardrobe. Your constrained figure moans, half-unconscious, as the $str[spider]woman pushes something inside her and $str[starts laying its eggs]pushes her fingers inside you. Without you noticing your hand has darted down between your legs, your fingers rubbing vigorously the wetness between your folds. It's something that you've never done before. No. You've done it hundreds of times. The memories come rushing to your head. As a little girl, rubbing yourself under the sheets, hoping no one would see you; as a teenager, home alone, browsing the dark side of Wumblr and fantasizing you'd run off with your own billionaire sadist; as a liberal in college, finally ordering all those toys you'd always wanted and stockpiling on batteries for the lonely weekends at the dormitories. (display:"work.initiate") (display:"clock")(link-repeat:"Patiently wait")[(display:"work wait")]<div id="center">$lib</div> The book is old, but well preserved. On the cover, instead of a title, is writen in big, gothic numbers "20-06-1763". You open a random page and find an odd, unrecognisable language: $B1[Teemee teela dohlasomee la laladohtee: Mee laladohtee. Ray teesosotee dohlasomee la mee teelaso; sorayfa mee ray laladohtee mee fasolala. Dd sofa ray meemeelateetee mee fasotee, lasorayfa, tee meefafa ray teesosotee dohlasomee la soraytee mee sosotee ray meeteetee dohsotee tee meesoraysofa mee ray meeso teesosotee tee dohmeetee so 'mee' solalatee tee mee fasotee (teedoh); teesofa so dohfa lalatee tee meeteetee faladoh teesosotee. Soteemee ray dohlasomee meetee mee solalasotee so raysotee solalatee teesosotee, la tee solala mee sofa sotee! meetee tee mee meemee ray teefa mee ray dohlasomee, tee doh so Lateeso fasoso teetee mee fasolala tee meesoraysofa. Ray lameetee so sotee sosolatee teela..] What is really odd however is not the unfamiliar language, but the fact that however neatly, the book is clearly written by hand, the occasional ink dot punctuating the otherwise flawless calligraphy. You place the book back and take another one, titled "05-03-1648", only to find the same mysterious language and identical almost perfect handwriting. $A[It's rather unusual to find manuscripts these days... is this a family record? But then if it was some form of ancient Romanian, I would have been able to pick up at least a couple of words. Interesting.] The dates stretch back a few hundred years at least, from what you can tell. The most recent title is "02-01-1945" and after that the records stop. There are, however, a number of untitled books waiting on the shelf. (display:"goto")[[Take an untitled book]] (set: _ti to 20)<div id="center">$lib</div> The book is completely blank, its white grainy paper giving off a peculiar scent as you flip through the pages. It feels nice to the touch, as if inviting you to grab a quill and write down something on it. You glance at the shelf - $A[There are a dozen more empty books, nobody would notice one missing..] (display:"goto")[[Take the book for yourself]] (set: _ti to 8)<div id="center">$lib</div> You've always wanted a cool old book to write in. You could make it your diary, or try writing the manuscript for your book in it. If you remember correctly, there was an inkwell in your room. $I[Blank diary added to inventory!] (display:"bk")[[Back->Enter the library]] (set: $diary_found to 1) (set: _ti to 8)<div id="center">$din</div> When you enter the dining hall the room is already prepared, white table cloths with candlesticks covering all tables. Through the windows you can see the darkness beyond the manor, only the full moon's shadow peeking through the dirty glass. Looking around, the place is completely desolate. You can't see any guests in sight. $A[Ionut mentioned that there are only two guests at the moment, but this is still a little sad. Are they not hungry, or just busy elsewhere?] On a table close to the window, Mihai is sitting alone, a glass of wine in his hand but no plate infront. He is the only person in the room. When he sees you he beckons you forward, gesturing a chair across from him. (display:"excl")[[Accept the invitation]] (display:"goto")[[Politely refuse and eat alone]] (set: _ti to 8)<div id="center">$din</div> You smirk and take the bait, sitting on the designated chair. There's nobody else around anyways, so you might as well talk to the eccentric owner. $Mi[So, Mr Reid, how do you find my hotel? Is it everything that you had hoped for?] Mihai's deep voice bears only the slightest of foreign accents, resembling more the intonation of a 19th century earl. Even now his golden headed cane is with him, leaning casually on the side of his chair. <img src="images/tr/characters/mihai2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char"> You ponder your reply: <div class="choices">(display:"talk")[['It's easy to see that this is a respectable establishment'->respect]] (display:"talk")[['It's yet too early to hold an opinion, Mr. Petrescu'->undecided]] (display:"talk")[['It looks good, but it's all just a façade for tourists'->scam]]</div> (set: $LinkPermaChoices to true) (set: _ti to 8)<div id="center">$din</div> You shake your head politely, raising your hands in an improvised gesture of apology. The owner nods dryly and doesn't insist. $A[What an eccentric guy..] Drinking wine alone in an empty hall may seem classy, but you suspect its just part of the façade that Mihai puts up to make his hotel more attractive to tourists. No doubt he expects you tell tales of the haunted manor and mysterious owner when you get back home, hopefully fooling some of your friends and relatives into checking out the place. Now that you think about it quite a few of the guys you know are gullible enough to at least hope there would be ghosts around the place, and no doubt the owner has arranged the occasional strange noise at night to keep the visitors coming... All in all the place is quite inspiring for the right kind of person, if you forget for a moment that it's all just a front. With grim cynicism you dig into your dinner which Ionut has brought discretely on your table. (set: _ti to 80) (display:"goto")[[Finish and leave]]<div id="center">$din</div> By the time you're done with your meal, Mihai has gone and none of the guests have bothered to show up. Slightly disappointed, you head to [your room]<room|. (set: $diner_1 to 1) (click:?room)[(goto:"Go back to your room")]<div id="center">$din</div> $a['There's clearly more to it than meets the eye'] - you smile at the owner knowingly - $a['such an ancient manor full of history and mysteries is clearly the sign of a dynasty that goes back many generations. I looked around a bit and I can't help but be very impressed.'] <img src="images/tr/characters/mihai2.png" width="450" align="right" class="char"> $Mi['And what are your observations so far?'] You draw in a deep breath. $a['Your library is rich and the books in it are authentic, from what I can tell. Your family portraits are numerous and masterfully crafted, especially for the periods when they were drawn. This gives away your noble roots.'] Mihai nods but doesn't say anything. $a['The building itself is more complex than is expected from a simple hotel, and I have no doubt that the towers that rise on top hold many family secrets. One even might wonder, Mr Petrescu, if your livelihood truly comes from guest fees...'] $Mi['I shall let you draw your own conclusions, Mr. Reid.'] You're a little unsure where to go from here, but luckily for you at this time Ionut comes with a full plate of meat and vegetables that he leaves in front of you before quietly walking away. You smile at the owner and [[concentrate on your food]]. After some searching you stumble upon an add in the paper that offers the job of a receptionist at a hotel in a small mountain Village in Romania. You pack your bags and head on a long trip, eventually crossing over Europe and arriving at your destination. Getting off the bus, you look around. The village itself is very small - barely a few dozen stone houses at best. The mountain air is clean and fresh, filling your nostrils with the scent of old pines and green moss. Save for a few electric lamps barely illuminating the street, it doesn’t look very modern. Judging by the architectural style, it hasn't moved in the last few centuries. Unable to locate the hotel, you talk to a strange man who sends you upwards a mountain trail, going along the river. The path is steep and it's getting dark, but after an hour of walking, you eventually arrive. The hotel is an ancient manor several stories high, a central part and two wings with several towers and balconies looming over the mournful garden. It’s hard to make out everything in the darkness, but you estimate it has at least two dozen guest rooms, perhaps more. $A[Wow... the place must have been a real luxury resort back in the day, perhaps then the village was a popular tourist destination? A shame, now it reeks of disuse and decay... Could be a cool place to stay, but I doubt they get many visitors. On the bright side, my job as a receptionist is probably going to be a whole lot of sitting around, waiting and doing nothing. Perhaps I could go back down to the village and find a pub, befriend the locals? Or maybe get back to that book I've always wanted to write?] There is a fence around it, with a gate that is locked. You shout out but nobody answers. Other <a href="https://www.patreon.com/XFiction" target="_blank">Patreon!</a> benefits include: -a patreon only version of the game with cheats to make total exploration of all content easier! $I[(Change clothes at a whim, boost secrets, teleport around, change your stats, redo choices)]. -access to the $I[Discord] to talk and discuss; -access to patreon polls and posts; As a direct result of Parteon funding, you can see below all the art that was added in this patch. <img src="images/tr/scenes/pentagram_trial_clean.png" width="350" > <img src="images/tr/scenes/pentagram_trial_tentacles.png" width="350" > <img src="images/tr/scenes/pentagram_god_hover.png" width="350" > <img src="images/tr/environments/woods.jpg" width="350" ><img src="images/tr/environments/garden.jpg" width="350" > If you would like to support this project, help add more great art to the game and vote what it will be, you can join me on <a href="https://www.patreon.com/XFiction">Patreon!</a> Right now we have also opened a new <a href="https://www.patreon.com/XFiction" target="_blank">Patreon!</a> tier, which will allow you to request 1 custom made, **illustrated** scene in the game. Check it out! Thank you for playing and feel free to leave any feedback or comments either on the game's page or directly on Discord. If you find any bugs let me know so I can fix them. <div id="center">$inn</div> Part of you is curious to see what's going to happen. You close your eyes and grit your teeth. But you just can't do it. This is too much. You jerk away from his hands and straighten your $suit. Enough is enouh. He gives you a sly grin. Defeated, you [[head back to your table->innhub]]. (set: _ti to 3) $att The darkness is waiting for you. Your curiosity burns. However... $A[Ionut did warn me not to go there, and it's only my first day...] It would really suck if you got fired on your first day. Now that you've learned the key trick, you're pretty confident you could get back here tomorrow. As long as it's $I[not your first day], you should probably be OK. You can come back later. But for now, it's probably best to go [[Back]]. (set: _ti to 3)You look at the bracelet on your wrist - it has (colour:"#FFCCCC")[(if: $bcharges is 0)[no crimson beads left on it.](elseif:$bcharges is 1)[a single crimson bead left on it.](else:)[$bcharges crimson beads on it.] ](if: $felicia_level<3)[ (if: $bcharges<2)[You're not entirely sure what that means, but you're worried about the beads dissapearing. It might be a sign of something bad. You get a trickle of cold sweat down your back. Perhaps you should talk to the the owner of the Antique Boutique.] (elseif: $bcharges<5)[You're not entirely certain if the color of the beads bears any significance. But they're connected to the bracelet, and the bracelet seems pretty important right now. Perhaps you should look into it.] ](if: $felicia_level>2)[ (if: $bcharges<1)[This is terrible! A cold sweat covers your back. If you don't find a way to recharge the bracelet, you'll die, this time for good!](elseif: $bcharges<2)[$R[This isn't good at all!] You still have a tiny breathing room, but if you don't find a way to recharge the bracelet soon, you can die for good! ](elseif: $bcharges<4)[You're starting to get a little worried, but push it to the back of your mind. For now you have enough charges left.](else:)[You have plenty of charges left for now. That's good.] ]You slowly wake up, your eyes opening to the familiar view of your room's ceiling. The dark mist in your mind slowly disperses. And then you remember. The dark wings. The Crooked smile. Teeth sinking into your neck, and the fire of desire burning in your belly. You blush and lift the covers of the bed to hide your face in shame. Something pops into your mind and you lift your wrist. The bracelet is there, and it has (colour:"#FFCCCC")[$bcharges crimson beads on it.] You breathe a deep sigh of relief. The haze in your mind is less now and you can think a little more clearly. But that's not the only change. While you have regained some clarity, there's also something else. You feel like a door has been opened, a door that you can't close back. You $A[liked] what happened. Despite the circumstances and despite your untimely demise, on a deep, visceral level you $A[needed] that. And now, another day begins. Somehow you know that the world is going to be different now. You want it to be. You wonder where all of this is going to lead you. They feel like intrusive thoughts in your head, messing with you. You wonder how life would be if you don't manage to change yourself back. Surely it won't be too bad, being a woman. [**Total Immersion**]<sel1| *(default)* You will experience the full introduction and the backstory leading up to your peculiar predicament. You will meet every character in the introduction. 2. [**Shortened intro**]<sel2| You will experience a short introduction, followed by the complete backstory leading up to your peculiar predicament. You will skip the introduction of minor events and characters and you will meet them during gameplay. 3. [**Get me into the action**]<sel3| You will experience a short introduction and a condensed version of the backstory. You will meet only the most central characters in the intro sequence (the rest you will meet directly during gameplay). (click:?sel1)[(set: $intro to 1) (goto:"start3") ] (click:?sel2)[(set: $intro to 2) (goto:"start3") ] (click:?sel3)[(set: $intro to 3) (goto:"start3") ] <div id="center"> <img src="images/tr/interface/Logo.png" style="max-width=100%;"> </div> <div class="check"> **STEP 2/2 - Settings** $I[Can be modified at any moment in the "Settings" menu.] (checkbox: 2bind $Tanim, " ") Text animations on death *Disabled: Text animations will only be displayed the first time you encounter them and will be skipped from then on.* (checkbox-fullscreen: " ") Fullscreen mode $R[**Fullscreen is recommended for best experience.**] (checkbox: 2bind $hintsON1, " ") Enable hints *If hints are enabled, the raven will appear occasionally on the sidebar. Click the raven for a hint. The thin tube-like organ presses down and easily overcomes the resistance of your relaxed muscles, sliding inside you. You realize that part of you is anticipating the action. Whether it is the spider venom or your perverted mind, you're almost looking forward to it. It's comforting to know that it doesn't matter. It's not your fault that you're enjoying it, and it doesn't change anything. Whether you want it or not, [[it's going to happen]].<div id="center">$dark</div> <img src="images/tr/scenes/spider_lewd3.png" width="800" align="center"> A hard, round object presses against you. Despite knowing what it will do to you, you realize how much you want it inside. The end begins to stretch you open and despite your relaxed body it struggles to get in. As the pressure slowly increases you sense your hole growing wider. In your half-awake state you dream of wolves under the full moon and nights of lust and passion. When the round object is halfway through, there is a brief moment of equilibrium, a stillness as you lie stretched and waiting. Then the tipping point comes and it sinks a millimeter further, after which your body takes over and greedily sucks it all the way in. There is a sudden and intense wave of pleasure, along with sensation of fullness in your gut. [[Then comes the next one]].<div id="center">$dark</div> <img src="images/tr/scenes/oviposition.gif" width="800" align="center"> The process repeats over and over, until you lose count, drifting into a haze of death and desire. Eventually the darkness takes you, (link-reveal-goto:"this time for good.","DIE")[ (set: $lust to it + 1) (set: $sanity to it - 5) (set: $deathlist to it + (a: "elise ovi"))] <img src="images/tr/scenes/spider_lewd2.png" width="800" align="center"><img src="images/tr/scenes/spider_lewd3.png" width="800" align="center"><div id="center">$lib</div> You take a stroll along the dusty shelves, trying to follow the source of the voice. Sometimes it's undeniably getting stronger, but just when you think you have it, it starts fading again. After a long game of cat and mouse, you eventually reach a strange place at the back of the library, where the tomes look especially old. One of them in particular draws your attention - you're either going crazy or it's the source of the voice. As soon as your fingers touch the ancient covers you feel a strange electric sensation run through you. This is not an ordinary book. You turn the front page - it's covered with odd symbols and diagrams that are moving and shifting in front of your very eyes. Just looking at them gives you a headache. $A[Reading this is going to be a complete nightmare! But who knows what secrets may be hidden inside...] (display:"brain")[[Try to read the tome]] (display:"bk")[[Leave the book alone->library]] <div id="center">$lib</div> You turn the pages and are immediately engrossed into a world of ancient stories of secrets and madness. The words seem to come alive on the page and before you know it an hour has passed and your mind is filled with tales of horrors you have never heard before. With a trembling hand, you close the tome. $A[They're right to say that knowledge has a price...] For all that you've learned, you feel that your grip on reality is a little looser. The shadows in the corner of your eye seem to be watching you, waiting for a moment of carelessness to strike at your back. You feel like you've lost a portion of your $clarity[sanity], but you've learned a few $M[secrets]. You leave the library in a hurry. (set: _ti to 60) (display:"goto")(link-reveal-goto:"Return to the reception","ground floor")[(set: $secrets +=3) ($nSecret: "The Maddness") (set: $sanity -=30) (set: $tome_madness to 1)]<img src="images/tr/interface/brain.png" style="position: absolute; float:left; margin-top:-5px;" width="50">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp<div id="center">$ant</div> You don't know why, but you feel like showing Felicia some of the flowers you found in the garden of The Crooked Elm. As soon as you pull them out, her eyes widen and she pounces on them, snatching them from your hand and running off somewhere inside the Antique Boutique. $a['Hello...?'] There is an eerie sensation of time stretching and condensing, like a bubble gum being chewed by a lazy panther. You have no idea where that mental image came from, but for some reason it sticks in your head. The minutes stretch, thick like honey, and the hours flow, quick like a mountain stream. After 5 minutes, according to the mechanical clock on the wall, the antique boutique regurgitates its owner back to the reception. $M['Let's forget this ever happened.'] Felicia straightens her clothes and returns behind the counter. Ask Mihai.'] He takes another slow puff from his cigarette. (set: _ti to 15) <div id="center">$lib</div> Sitting at the floor of the library you slowly compose yourself and get dressed again. Lavius has already gone, though you seem to have momentarily lost track of time. A few things bubble to your conscious attention. First, the $R[hunger] that has been increasing all day has finally subsided. What is worrying however is that even if the urges have gone down, your mind still feels very hazy. In fact, it even feels $A[hazier] than before. You feel as if you're a little drunk and concentration takes an effort. You know you should probably be more alarmed by this, but in your current state all you can do is quietly note the phenomenon. Another thing that you notice is that your bracelet hasn't changed, despite the recent "feeding". This is also something that should perhaps worry you. Back on your feet again, you finally manage to regain some of your focus, though it's clear that something isn't quite right. The library is quiet. You turn towards the distant end of the room - the rows of shelves seem almost never ending. $A[Did someone- did someone call my name?] You hesitate. (set: _ti to 15) (display:"goto")(link-reveal-goto:"Explore the deep end","Explore the deep end")[(set: $lust -=30) (set: $sanity -=15)] <div id="center">$lib</div> Walking down the dusty aisles you begin to experience a strange sensation, one that you have felt before. There is something wrong with the space around you. The lines of the aisles somehow bend in weird ways, straight paths loop back into themselves. The further you go, the stronger the feeling becomes. The air is thick and still like glass. The bits of dust hang frozen in the distance, illuminated by rays of still light. You follow the gut feeling, turning left and right. You reach a point where you make 4 consecutive right turns, which should have looped you around a shelf... but instead you come across a [[familiar desk]]. (set: $elder_avatar to 1) $I[Character entry added in journal] ($nChar: "Vasil, the Father") (set: _ti to 8) (display:"bk")[[Back->Floor 2]] <div id="center">$mount</div> Feeling a little overwhelmed, you head away from the village center, past the few rows of stone houses and into the nearby trees. The forest is not very dense here and you can still see the village rooftops through the branches. Unlike the deeper parts of the forest, the sparse trees here let through enough sunshine for grass to grow. The weather is just perfect and you take a moment to stroll through the greenery, before sitting on a soft mossy patch under a pine tree. $A[So... I really am a woman now, huh?] You run your hands from your chest to your hips, feeling the new curves. Part of you still can't believe it. (set: _ti to 15) (unless: (history:) contains "Get a feel of this new body")[(display:"heart")[[Get a feel of this new body]] ](unless: (history:) contains "Reflect on the situation")[(display:"brain")[[Reflect on the situation]] ](display:"bk")[[Return to the village->Exit the shop]] <div id="center">$mount</div> You don't want to undress here, but your curiosity is getting the better of you. You let your hands wander a little, exploring the changes. $A[Most of my body feels kinda the same.... and yet different.] The $suit that you got from Felicia is a nice reminder of your past self, but now that you really think about it, you start to wonder how it would feel to wear actual feminine clothing, perhaps something simple and light... You touch your face like a child, discovering a new toy for the first time. Your lips definitely feel fuller and softer. Your features haven't changed drastically, but at the same time you are a new person, quite literally... Several minutes fly by as you feel around your body, trying to compare how things have changed. (set: _ti to 8) (set: $task_female to 1) (unless: (history:) contains "Reflect on the situation")[(display:"brain")[[Reflect on the situation]] ](display:"bk")[[Return to the village->Exit the shop]] <div id="center">$mount</div> You try to organize things in your head. It's quite bewildering when you think about it. The observable state of reality contradicts everything that you thought you knew about the world. $A[There is still so much that people don't know, isn't there?] After meeting these strange characters, going through changes yourself and even seeing time rewind, you are starting to question the concepts of science and rationality that have guided you through life so far. Perhaps the only way to truly understand the events around you is to embrace the occult and try to play by their rules? But then again, some part of you still believes that there has to be a rational explanation for everything. Even if magic is real, it should obey a similar set of rules as science... You feel that you have overcome a part of your internal turmoil and your thinking has become a little clearer. This place is strange, and its inhabitants are even stranger. But perhaps it would not be wise to be so blunt with your host. $a['I was just wondering about your hotel. The architecture doesn't seem modern, it must have been built by your ancestors. I am very interested in history, so was wondering if you can tell me a bit about that.'] $Mi['I see.'] Mihai observes you for a moment, tapping his fingers on the top of his golden cane. $Mi['I admire your interest. Indeed, The Crooked Elm has stood here for more than 400 years. It was first built by my fa-, I mean great-great-great-grandfather Vasil Petrescu, when our family first moved to these lands.
