It's clear that getting information out of him regarding the supernatural will not be easy. $A[Perhaps he doesn't trust me yet?] You cough lightly, clearing your throat. $a['I was just wondering if you've noticed anything out of the ordinary.'] You feel like it's been an eternity since the last time Mihai blinked. $Mi[I think you are looking at things from the wrong angle, young miss. There is no such thing as *ordinary*. Everything is a matter of perspective. What is normal for the spider is chaos for the fly.'] He makes a meaningful pause. $Mi['My advice to you is - don't be the fly. By the time you realise you've been caught in a web, it will be too late.'] Your eyes lock and for a moment you feel the urge to tell him, but ultimately decide against it. $A[It may be too late for the fly, but not for me, old man...] Mihai nods, then pushes the coins towards you. (display:"goto")(link-goto:"Continue","ground floor")<div id="center">$lav</div> (if: (history:)'s last is "cabin inside")[You open the trap door and descend down the ladder into the darkness. After a flight of stairs you emerge at a familiar location. You can continue further down to Sabrina's room or head to the laboratory part of the lair.](else:)[You continue down the hallway, passing by several more doors which seem to be locked. At the far end you come across a stairway, one way going up and the other leading down. $A[When Lavius brought me here, I think we went down to his private chambers... that bastard!] The memory is still a fresh scar in your mind, filling you with bittersweet emotions.] (set: _ti to 2) (if: $cabin is 0)[(display:"goto")[[Go up]] (display:"goto")[[Go down->lower hallway]]](else:)[(display:"goto")[[Continue down->lower hallway]] (display:"goto")[[Go to the laboratory section->Go back upstairs]] (display:"bk")[[Go back up to the cabin->cabin inside]]]<div id="center">$lav</div> You take the stairs up, climbing an increasingly narrow passage that culminates with at a small square platform with no doors. It's pretty dark and at first it seems like a dead end, but then you notice there's ladder propped on your right. Your eyes trace it up to the ceiling, where you make out a rectangular shape. $A[Is that a trap door...?] You grab the ladder and climb up, pushing the trap door open with one hand. A puff of dust raises as you peak your head into the space above. $A[Wait, is this...?] You can't see very well from here, but the place looks familiar. You'll need to take a closer look. (set: _ti to 4) (display:"goto")[[Climb up->cabin up]]<div id="center">$lav</div> Taking the flight of stairs down, you emerge in a second hallway. Now that you are not drunk, you can take the time to properly look around. Unlike the floor above, here the metallic valves and copper wires are few and far between, instead giving way to ornate chandeliers and a thick carpet. $A[I can definitely see why he calls it a "lair"...] You walk in a thick silence, your footsteps completely absorbed by the red carpet. You see a door on the right, which you recognise. It's purple with a golden handle. It's Lavius' room. Farther down the hall there is also another door, which is black with a silver handle. After it you can see another flight of stairs leading further down. <div id="center">$lav</div> Lavius' room is exactly how you remember it. **User Interface** => Across the board improvements to UI performance and behavior: -The sidebar is now always a consistent size; -The different tabs in YOU are now consistent sizes; -The different tabs in JOURNAL are now consistent sizes; -tweaked sizes and positions of some UI elements; -Entering a protected passage from the sidebar (such as Journal or You) will now grey out the other options instead of completely removing them; **Fixes** -fixed a critical navigation bug in chapter 2; -fixed a rare but critical navigation bug at the inn (thanks to Sarah113); -improved quest progression when skipping intro; -changed Felicia's quest line to avoid a potential broken flag, causing the task to persist; -other minor fixes and typo fixes; ================================================ **Permanent choices** -the "Choices" section of the Journal is now operational; -certain permanent choices will now be recorded there; -permanent choices appear as red links instead of blue; -added a roleplay-oriented permanent choice at the end of the introduction; **Felicia** -added a new end-game story after paying her debt; -Felicia now has a permanent choice allowing to determine the type of relationship; -Idle banter and dialogue will change based on relationship; ==>added new art: Lovers; ==>added new art: Mistress; **Elise** -reworked the final stages of Elise's relationship flow; -Elise now has a permanent choice allowing to determine the type of relationship; **Loyalty and Betrayal** If your relationships with Felicia and Elise go into conflict, a special event will take place; -this system is still a work in progress and will be expanded; **The Cabin** -you can now unlock a shortcut to use the front door; -internal navigation has been improved; **General cleanup** -fixed some UI inconsistencies on old passages; -fixed typos and bugs; -if you have talked with Zach, you will get some extra time before having to go back. **Chapter 2** ==>added new art for the werewolf in human form; -optimized the flow and structure of core navigation (most is behind the scenes, for now) **Patreon** -you can now alter permanent choice via a new menu;] (link-reveal:"0.2.16")[ <hr> ==CHAPTER1== **The Crypt** -added a new location: The Crypt; -added the possibility to visit the Crypt from the cemetery; -added the possibility to visit the Crypt from Ionut's walk in the rain; -added an erotic scene with two variations; -added new art for The Crypt; **Ionut event** -added a new branch of variations to the Ionut event at the cemetery; -removed some of the restrictions for the event trigger (you should see it more often); **Other**: -added new art for Sabrina body modification ritual; -added new art when the werewolf drags you outside; ==CHAPTER2== **The Elder** -added new art; -improved interaction; **A game of pool** -added a new win event: a walk with the wolf; **General** -tweaked the values of some lust and sanity gains/losses; -added a new quest: The Grand Conspiracy (in progress)] (link-reveal:"0.2.15")[ <hr> ===========0.2.15A=========== -improved time flow: time taken by actions will now update immediately; -improved sidebar responsiveness: stat changes should now be visible immediately; -global action cost: all actions that do not explicitly have a time cost will now take 1 minute to perform. -numerous minor fixes; -talking about your death with Felicia now takes into account more nuances in certain events; -fixed body module's description at start of game; -improved body module behaviour and descriptions in some specific configurations; ================================================ **Implemented body module** -there is now a visual reflection of you look, located in You->body; -there are 3 breast types - small / perky / big ; -there are 4 hip types - default / thigh gap / curvy / curvy thigh gap -there are 3 piercing types - 1 bar / 2 bars / rings =>any combination of the above is possible and will be visually represented; -added new art; -can now also be encountered at the cemetery; **Sabrina** -Sabrina's hub has been cleaned up and polished a little; -there is a new option that allows to modify your body; -she can upgrade your piercing; You know that there is still some time before nightfall, but you'd better not delay your way back to the manor. [(display:"goto")Jump through the window]<jump| (display:"goto")[Go to your room]<go| { (click:?jump)[ (if: $bcharges>0)[(goto:"jump window")] (else:)[(replace:?jump)[$sys[You have no charges left on the bracelet, you can't jump.]]] ] (click:?go)[ (if: $elise_relationship is "none" and $Loyalty_choice is "none")[(goto:"elise final transition")] (elseif: $Loyalty_choice is "none")[(goto:"elise short transition")] (else:)[(goto:"room2")] ]}<div id="center">$att</div> Thinking about, you realize that the cat is right. There is still more that you can learn. And knowledge is power. Now that you know how to navigate around danger... it doesn't hurt to stay a while longer. You approach the large window door - it leads on to a balcony. The full moon basks the manor and surrounding forest in a shower of silver rays and the black dead branches creak in the gusts of wind. Here from the attic, the fall is surprisingly high, you remark as you stand up on the railing. The cobblestones on the ground below are hard and thick. You seem to have made up your mind. Your descent is quick and silent. Your body breaks on impact, leaving a crimson splash on the black and silver canvas of the night. Darkness (link-reveal-goto:"takes you.","DIE")[ (set: $sanity to it -1) (set: $lastdeath to "suicide") (set: $deathlist to it + (a: "suicide"))]<div id="center">$att</div> You shake your head, pushing the cat aside. $a['I've had enough misadventures for now, thank you very much.'] $M['Your choice, girl.'] The cat gives you a little nod and jumps onto the terrace, disappearing into the night. You stare into the emptiness of the attic hallway, then shrug and head to your room. It's been a long and eventful day and now you long for it to be over. As you place your hand on the door knob, a voice comes over your shoulder: $E['Who were you talking to, girl?'] You turn around, but don't see anyone. $E['Up here, tsk.'] (set: _ti to 2) (display:"goto")[[Look up]]<div id="center">$room </div> Yawning from the long and exhausting day, you put the few pages of your manuscript in the drawer and blow out the candle. The room plunges in silver darkness, the silhouettes outlined by the shine of the almost full moon outside. You lie on the hard mattress, thinking about the mysterious events of the day. The bracelet is hanging comfortably around your wrist, its presence somehow comforting against the creaking of the old building and the howling of the wind in the dead branches outside. Before you know it, the darkness takes you... The night passes uneventfully.. -added background art for underground lair; **Chapter 2** -the win condition for surviving the attack has been changed with an additional requirement; **Lavius in the garden** -polished dialogue and added new options if you reply this branch more than once; ==>added new scene with Lavius in the garden; -added 3 new pieces of art, depending on what Alexandra is wearing; -added dynamic descriptions based on stats; -added Trait-unlockable options; **Wolf in the garden** -polished existing scene with new outfit variations; -added the outfit-appropriate art to each variation; -added an alternative encounter if you do this branch more than once; **The Henchmen** -added new story branch: meeting the men in the forest; -added new challenge to branch; -added new erotic scenes to the challenge; -added new art to the challenge; **Patreon** -added new Lavius scene to Gallery; -added new Henchmen scene to Gallery; -made Stat Edit buttons hitbox much larger and easier to click; <div id="center">0.3.04</div> <hr> **General** -Replaced the color of $U[unimplemented options] from red to grey-blue to avoid confusion with permanent choices. -added new background art: the dining room (day); -added new background art: the dining room (dark); **Chapter 2** -improved navigation nodes and event triggers around the game room and the library; -The Grand Conspiracy questline can now be advanced one more step -added a quest recap after moving the box to the basement; -updated waking up recap after a death; **The Mermaid** -has a new interaction node for all actions and can be found in the basement at all times of day; -meeting her for the first time no longer leads to a dead end; -new challenge added; -it is now possible to uncover Lavius' motives in the "Grand Conspiracy" questline. -new erotic scene added; -new art for the erotic scene added; **The Elder** -updated interactions; -can now be convinced to help you if you have the right pieces of information; **Pit of Death** -added new location: certain actions will lead you here; -added new erotic event: the slime; -added new art: the slime; -added new erotic event: the lurker; -added new art: the lurker; **Elise** -the Elise x Felicia branch no longer terminates in a dead end; -it is now possible to uncover Elise's motives in the "Grand Consipracy" questline. **Patreon** -reworked the entire Patreon menu interface (Desktop only); -brand new Gallery tab! -brand new Travel tab! -brand new Choices tab! -improvements to Stats, Body and Clothes tabs; **Other** -updated some icons -typo fixes; -updated a few more interaction nodes in Ch1 to prevent potential stats being re-applied when exiting a menu; <div id="center">0.3.03</div> <hr> **General** -added background art for Elise's room (tidied and untidied); -added background art for the first floor of The Crooked Elm; **Lavius** -added new scene and variations when going with Lavius to his lair for a second time; -added new art for this scene; -added a new rare encounter after you've met the old woman for the second time; -added new art for the second encounter; **The Inn** -reworked the way the main hub works, adding more granular changes to the descriptions of what everyone else is doing following your interactions. The inn should now feel more responsive and alive; -added a new character - the old woman (only appears later in the story) -added a new branch - milking at the farm; -added illustration for this branch; -added a new branch when revisiting the old woman after the farm encounter; **Chapter 1** Spider Amulet -Elise's gift can now be transformed into a Spider amulet; -Amulet reduces significantly the time requirements for all actions; -Amulet can be worn or taken off at any time; -if you have romanced Ionut, he will now be sad when he kills you. **Patreon** -added the option to instantly obtain the speed amulet; -added new scenes to the gallery; **Engine** -moved to Harlowe 3.2.2, which patches several core engine errors that were introduced in the previous patch (If you've seen undefined variable errors when loading, that was caused by custom macro data type being corrupted in specific instances) -introduced a modification that prevents errors and debug functions from popping up during play if a non-critical error occurs; **Fixes** -fixed a few instances of traits being increased after closing a menu; -Ionut's scene when washing the dishes correctly takes account of what Alex is wearing; -fixed an incomplete branch form the Elder showing placeholder text when trying to convince him (branch has been removed for now until it's complete); -fixed day showing up as Wednesday for a bit when jumpstarting chapter 2; -fixed being killed by Lavius the second time not properly registering when talking with Felicia the next day; -fixed a case where Felicia would offer you pheromones even after you already have them; <div id="center">0.3.02</div> <hr> **General** -added new background art for the Antique Boutique; -created new sprite for Felicia on large screen devices; **Chapter1** -added new art set for Sabrina's grotesque training; -added new art set for Elise giving her special piercings; -extended the Elise piercing event with new description; -added new art set for the Fishing for Worms event; **Chapter 2** -the library and game room have new navigation nodes and can be visited more freely regardless of time of day; -improved overall navigation and flow of main events; **Ruxandra** -Ruxandra's story is now fully looped (the first fully complete loop module of Chapter 2); -new story branches: you can now complete the Ruxandra event without dying; -new variations; -new permanent choice; -new item: successfully completing Rux' event now gives an item that can be equiped and unequiped at any time in inventory; **Mobile** -redesigned the top bar; -changed the text links into icons; -added saving and loading; -implemented the menu upgrade that allows free navigation between menus without having to go back to the story first; -improved interface of the main body; **Patreon** -added a new benefit: unlimited and customizeable save slots; **Fixes** -passages with a background should now be properly scrollable even if the text is very short; -Ruxandra's call is no longer infinitely repeatable if you've already dug up her grave; -improved time pausing and resuming when entering and exiting menus; <div id="center">0.3.01</div> <hr> **Chapter 1** -added a few improvements to the "Thoughts" module when waking up after a reset; -added a new option for Sabrina's training: love for the grotesque; You flip through the pages - it looks a little dry and tedious, but most nevertheless understandable. $A[Might be my best bet...] (set: _ti to 15) (display:"goto")[[Read a few chapters from the tome->ghost linguistics]] <div id="center">$lib</div> You take the tome to a nearby table and sit on the chair, getting comfortable. $A[Let's see what this is all about...] The sentences are long and the words in them even longer. You find yourself frowning often and rubbing your temples, trying to understand the differences between $A[$unav2[s̵͖͎͖̰̪͆Ŝᶠֆʄʝ]] and $A[$unav2[ǟf̴̨̤̣͍̳̣̆̒͜ᶠֆʄʝ]]. After half an hour and a ligh headache, you feel like you're starting to grasp a few basic concepts. $A[If I'm understanding this correctly, an invocation can be reversed by changing the enunciation of the genitif...] You sigh and close the book. That's enough for a day, and even if you wanted, you'd probably not be able to cram more in your head right now. (set: _ti to 5) (set: $necklace to 5) (display:"goto")[[Slowly walk away->evil t 1]] <div id="center">$gar</div> $a[$unav2[ǟf̴̨̤̣͍̳̣̆̒͜ᶠֆʄʝŜᶠֆʄʝǟf̴̨̤̣͍̳̣̆̒͜千n̸̘̣̉͐̃͂ᎸŜᶠֆʄʝǟf̴̨̤̣͍̳̣̆̒͜s̵͖͎͖̰̪͆Ꮈຖ໓n̸̘̣̉͐̃͂千h҉s̵͖͎͖̰̪͆Ŝᶠֆժʂƒʝąղƒd̶s̶f̶j̶a̶♐︎🙰ǟf̴̨̤̣͍̳̣̆̒͜ᶠֆʄʝ!]] You speak the words that the spirit thought you, but reverse the meaning using your knowledge of the occult. Everything feels surreal, like you're in some sort of trans. You feel a connection to the world beyond, and for the first time a sense of power and understanding of the ethereal threads that bind it to this reality. What have you done...!] The wind intensifies and the old tree creaks, its branches twisting and turning more than ever before. (set: _ti to 5) (display:"talk"){(link: "'I did what I had to'")[ (if: $deathlist contains "evil tree")[(goto:"Trick Rux know")] (else:)[(goto:"Trick Rux chance")] ]}<div id="center">$gar</div> $a['There's no need to pretend anymore, Ruxandra. I know you were planning to trick me.'] The runes on the tree begin to glow a bright red, as if a giant flame has been kindled inside. There isn't any heat that you can feel, only a ghostly breeze that blows your hair. $Ru['How- how did you know....'] $a['I'm not that dumb you know,'] you chuckle. There's no need to give her the satisfaction that she had you the first time. The only thing that matters is that you have the last laugh. $a['Or did you see my horns and breasts and think that I'm only good to be fucked and to do what I'm told?'] $Ru['Who told you...? Succubi are primitive and dumb...'] the spirit's voice comes as a low hiss, filled with anger and hate. As the runes continue to glow, her presence seems to wane from this world. $a['No one did. I figured it out. By my-self!'] $Ru['You are cleverer than I thought...'] her voice comes as a faint whisper, desperately clinging to its last anchor to this world. You can tell that she doesn't have much time left. $Ru['Please, spare me... I will do whatever you want... help how I can... please...'] The wind howls in the dying branches. Lightning strikes the old tree, splitting it into half. You fall back on the ground, tumbling in the dry grass. A wave of energy blasts from the tree like a dying scream, then a sudden silence falls over the garden. (set: _ti to 10) <div class="choices">(display:"goto")(link-reveal-goto: "Spare her", "Spare Ruxandra")[(set: $RuxChoice to "mercy")($nChoice: "Ruxandra: Mercy")] (display:"goto")(link-reveal-goto: "Finish the spell", "Banish Ruxandra")[(set: $RuxChoice to "justice")($nChoice: "Ruxandra: Justice")]</div> (set: $LinkPermaChoices to true)<div id="center">$gar</div> You get back up on your feet and pant down the dirt from your $suit. The garden feels eerie. The old tree stands splintered in half, with no sign of the runes or any other supernatural activity. Its dead branches no longer twist without breeze, instead laying completely motionless. $A[A sad end...] As you examine the aftermath of the lightning, you notice something poking from the charred wound. $A[The necklace!] The peculiar trinket is lying in the center of the tree, right where the lightning split it in half. Oddly enough, it doesn't seem to have been damaged in the process. You pick up the necklace and look it over. Just like before, it seems to have a reassuring aura. $A[It must have been some amulet of protection... perhaps why the spirit needed it so badly.] In any case, it's no use to her now. Perhaps it will serve you better. (set: _ti to 3) (display:"goto")[[Take the necklace ->necklace end]]<div id="center">$gar</div> (set: $pers_keys to true) You grab the necklace from the charred tree and put it on. It feels like a hard-earned war trophy and you're more than a little proud of how you handled the situation. $A[No spirit is going to mess with me...!] As you stroll back to the Crooked Elm, you take one last glance at the old tree. Its crooked silhouette is barely distinguishable among the other dead things in the garden. $A[I wonder if someone will even notice...] In any case, you have more urgent matters to worry about now. With the necklace reassuringly around your neck, you decide to press on with the matters at hand. A black hand gives you a pat and then you feel a rope pressing against your body. She goes to a drawer and comes towards you, carrying somehting. $E['These will be for your tits, girl. To remind you of me. Tsk, tsk.'] You allow yourself to look up a little. You can see that she is holding two large metal spiders which appear quite heavy.
